page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: The 12 square kilometres of our study is a rural area to the South East of the ancient historical town of St Andrews. The land is fairly flat and arable. Crops are varied, comprising mainly barley and in addition turnips, wheat, potatoes, oil seed rape, peas, etc. Apart from the tenanted Kingsmuir Estate all the farms are owned by the farmers. Several houses scattered in the area are not part of farming. There is a school, church and items of archeological interest. The main road from St. Andrews to Anstruther A959 almost bisects Dunino Parish which has survived, probably for wealth and historical reasons, in spite of it being surrounded by much larger Parishes. Dunino appears to mean fortified fort (Dun) by the stream(Ino) Population 110 adults.
